casebody.data:
ALBERT L. COLES, Plaintiff and Respondent, v. ALBERT COLES, Defendant and Appellant.

Before Curtis, Ch. J., and Freedman, J.

Decided November 11, 1879. Action brought to recover the balance found due the plaintiff on the dissolution of a partnership between him and defendant. The answer, among other things, set forth the causes which prompted the defendant to dissolve the partnership. On motion, the allegations in these respects were stricken out as irrelevant. Defendant appealed. Sackett & Lang, attorneys, and of counsel, for appellant. Edward S. Clinch, attorney, and of counsel, for respondent. Per Curiam.

The order appealed from should be affirmed with costs.
